- Node >= 16

```bash
sudo apt install npm
```

```bash
npm install mermaid
```

3. Alternatively, you can also use Yarn or PNPM to install mermaid:
```bash
# Yarn
```

The webpage provides instructions for installing the `mermaid-cli` tool. Here are the steps to install the tool on a Debian/Ubuntu Linux system from the source code:

1. Make sure Node.js is installed on your system. You can install Node.js using the following command:
   ```
   sudo apt update
   sudo apt install nodejs npm
   ```

2. Clone the `mermaid-cli` repository from GitHub:
   ```
   git clone https://github.com/mermaid-js/mermaid-cli.git
   cd mermaid-cli
   ```

3. Install the dependencies using npm:
   ```
   npm install
   ```

4. Build the project:
   ```
   npm run build
   ```

5. To use the `mmdc` command-line tool, you can either install it globally:
   ```
   npm install -g @mermaid-js/mermaid-cli
   ```

6. Or, you can run it locally without installing globally:
   ```
   node ./dist/index.js
   ```

7. You can also run the tool using `npx`:
   ```
   npx @mermaid-js/mermaid-cli
   ```

These are the steps to install and build the `mermaid-cli` tool on a Debian/Ubuntu Linux system from the source code.
